intro: Barkeria lindleyana subsp. cyclotella, commonly known as the spiral-leaved barkeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodland or grassland habitats. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet in color and are arranged in dense clusters. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its morphological adaptations.
